sentence.Network_en: He is an outstanding imitator and can impersonate all the well - known politicians.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个出色的模仿者,他能扮演所有著名的政治家.

sentence.Network_en: You're unique and don't be an imitator or a copy.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是神对你的巨大尊敬.

entry.def: An imitator is someone who copies what someone else does, or copies the way they speak or behave.

example.ex: He doesn't take chances; that's why he's survived and most of his imitators haven't.
example.tran: 他不冒险：这就是为什么他得以幸存,而他的大部分仿效者却没有。
一群猫王埃尔维斯的模仿者

means.word_mean: 1. someone who (fraudulently) assumes the appearance of another
2. someone who copies the words or behavior of another

auth_sentence.content: But the monkeys consistently chose the imitator.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the monkeys consistently chose the imitator.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the monkeys consistently chose the imitator.

auth_sentence.content: One clue would be if the monkey chose to spend more time near the human imitator than the nonimitator, after the ball game.
auth_sentence.res_content: One clue would be if the monkey chose to spend more time near the human imitator than the nonimitator, after the ball game.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: One clue would be if the monkey chose to spend more time near the human imitator than the nonimitator, after the ball game.

auth_sentence.content: So he screened at No Dance, an all-digital video Sundance imitator held at a nearby mall.
